Nothing happens!

If I first select Inbox of IMAP account, then new folder was created as expected.

Creation of new folder in IMAP account.

comments.raw_text:
Variants of this bug's phenomenon on folders in Copies&Folders;
  - drafts, templates, sent folder : Drafts, Templates, Sent of this IMAP account
  - Drafts, Templates, Sent is not created yet
  - no automatic mail check
  - IMAP folder of this IMAP account is not selected when last termination of Tb
  If just after restart of Tb and before first IMAP folder open in this account,
    Save As Draft, Save As Templates, Sent mail copy to Sent folder,
    doesn't complete or silently fails then does do nothing.
    Drafts, Templates, Sent is not automatically created. 
I often saw this bug's phenomenon and above, and still easily can see, because I usually force "no automatic login to server after restart of Tb".
Confirming. 

I think this bug is "create" version of bug 534994 for "lsub"(Subscribe).
> Bug 534994 : (IMAP, blank subscription list is shown, because login for LSUB is required if no cached connection is available but it fails)
This bug is perhaps next;
  if "create" is requested when login to server is not done yet,
  login is attempted but the login attempt fails, then "create" silently fails.
I didn't open separate bugs for each phenomenon, because even LSUB doesn't work if login to IMAP server is not done yet after restart of Tb.

Can you get IMAP log?

comments.raw_text:
Another related phenomenon with preconditions from comment #0:
- having corrupted mail from scenario of bug 667288 comment #15 in IMAP folder.
-> result: folder pane column 'size': 35 KB; mbox file size: 35 KB
- copy same mail with correct header from local folder to IMAP folder.
-> result: folder pane column 'size': 71 KB; mbox file size: 35 KB, so the new mail is not copied to the local store file.
Folder properties -> Synchronization -> download now or restarting TB doesn't change this.
Only unsubscribing + subscribing the folder helped to get 71 KB into the local store file.
comments.author: Ulf.Zibis@gmx.de
